intro: Dyschoriste oaxacensis, commonly known as the Oaxaca dyschoris, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
